content.description:
THE TORTOISE AND THE HARE 5.9 ** 95 M (7b)

On the far left end of the Main Face climb the right side through the small roof, angling left to the 2 ring (rappel) anchors above the top ledge. Sustained bolt protected climbing after the easy gear protected start. Makes the best rap route for the main face. Needs cleaning....
content.protection: mixed - 7 bolts and some large to medium cams
content.location: 2nd from the left of the main face

content.description:
TERRAPIN STATION 5.9 ** 105' M (6b)

Takes a direct line up the middle of the upper (main) south face (goes around the left end of the overhang). Start at the lowest point on the face. Needs a range of cams/nuts to protect. 2 ring anchors just below the top with a single bolt on top. Possible to lower with a 60m rope.
content.protection: mixed - 6 bolts and a range of cams (tiny to large).
content.location: From the lowest point on the south face to left of the small overhang.

content.description:
SHAPE SHIFTER 5.11b ** 80' F (8b)

Begin 5' right of the start of Raven and Bear, in the mock orange bushes. Climb the face right of the corner to the anchors just below the lip, avoiding using the crack on the left.
content.location: Left side of the face right of the vertical corner system at the left end of the main face

content.description:
THE RAVEN AND THE BEAR 5.8+ ** 95' M (2b)

Climbs the cracks/corner beginning about 5' right of The Tortoise and the Hare, traverse right at the top of the corner (bolted crux). Scramble 15' to share the top anchors with Peyote Road.
content.protection: mixed - mostly trad wide range of cams needed
content.location: the vertical corner system at the left end of the main wall

content.description:
PEYOTE ROAD 5.9 * 85' F (8b)

Begin about 15' left of the lone pine, and climb directly up to the 2 bolt anchor over the top (above the huge boulder). Sustained and interesting climbing with good rests.
content.location: face left of the diagonal corner

content.description:
MAGIC THEATRE 5.8 *** 90' F(10b)

Begin about 15' up the 3rd class gully to the right of Terrapin Station (and 15' left of Isle of Everywhere) and follow the bolts directly below the right end of the mid-face overhang. Sustained, excellent, reachy climbing . 2 chain anchor on the top edge.
content.location: 3rd from right (stays right of the small overhang half way up main face)

content.description:
LIGHTNING BOLT CRACK 5.6 R * 105 G/TR

The prominent jagged crack on the shaded face left of center on the South face with 2 chain anchors just below the top. As a gear route this is scary with the 5.6 crux  unprotected (stepping up through the small roof). Will be better with a couple of bolts.  The cracks below (up to 5.3), and above (up to 5.5) are delightful and easy to protect.
content.protection: gear or best to toprope until some bolts are added.
content.location: In the middle section of Turtle Island, begin from the base about 50' down and left of the upper main wall ledge.

content.description:
ISLE OF EVERYWHERE 5.8- ** 90' M (4b)

From the top of a prominent boulder up the ramp 30' right (E) of Terrapin Station, climb the face directly below the 2 ring anchors on top, with consistently good, moderate climbing (much of it protected by small to medium cams in horizontal cracks).
content.protection: mixed - 4 bolts and wide range of cams

climbs.name: I WILL FIGHT NO MORE FOREVER

content.description:
I WILL FIGHT NO MORE FOREVER 5.7 ** 95' M (5b)

Begin about 10' left of The Tortoise and the Hare and climb up the face and crack to the bolt protected upper face. Shares the 2 ring anchor above the large ledge on top. Very enjoyable climb, needs a full range of cams.
content.protection: mixed, 5 bolts and a full range of cams
content.location: 1st route on the left end of the main face

content.description:
GHOST DANCE 5.9 ** 70 F (6b)

Climbs the left edge of the lighter streak of rock on the right side of the main South face. Start just left of the base of the diagonal crack with the small pine in it (scramble up to belay at the top of the pedestal). Crux near the top. 2 bolt anchors over the top.
content.location: 1st route on the far right side of the south face

content.description:
EAGLE AND COYOTE 5.8+ ** 100 M (1-3b)

Begin at the base of the large diagonal corner/crack. Follow it left as much as possible and continue up after the crack ends to exit the face through the right side of piled blocks to share 2 bolt anchors with Peyote Road.
content.protection: mixed, mostly trad with a wide range of cams needed
content.location: climbs the diagonal left facing corner

content.description:
COUP STICK SONG 5.9- ** 100' F (7b)

Starts at the base of Eagle And Coyote crack and climbs directly up to the 2 ring anchors 5' below the lip. Bottom 25' is 5.2 with gear if you want, upper part is sustained and great.
content.location: Middle of the face right of obvious diagonal corner/roof

content.description:
TRAIL OF TEARS 5.10c *** 100' F (9b)

Takes a direct line beginning at the base of the Eagle And Coyote corner (20' right of the lone small pine tree on the cliff face). Climb the corner and at the 2nd bolt continue directly up. At the top bolt traverse right to share the ring anchors with Coup Stick Song.
content.location: Left side of the face just right of the prominent diagonal corner/roof
